DataElement.preferredName: Imaging Technique Performed Per Study Protocol Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate if the imaging procedure was performed according to the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Imaging Technique Performed Per Study Protocol
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Executed and carried through to completion._For each, generally denoting a ratio._The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Executed and carried through to completion.:For each, generally denoting a ratio.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: Executed and carried through to completion.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/16/17 jk Changed Context, registration and WF statuses, OC to C17369 and added to NCI Standards CSI per Rnd 5 finalization task.  6/18/13 created for CT Image Acquisition CRF module; update to ECOG-ACRIN context. jc

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Helical CT scanning performed per protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was cross-sectional imaging (CT/MRI of chest, abdomen and pelvis) performed within 4 weeks prior to Step 1 Randomization and within 6 weeks prior to planned start of trial treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was cross-sectional imaging (CT/MRI of chest, abdomen and pelvis) performed within 4 weeks prior to Step 2 Randomization and within 6 weeks prior to planned start of trial treatment?

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
